meanings.definition: To treat or combine with mercury.
meanings.sent1: The scientist decided to mercurate the metal to see its reaction.
meanings.sent2: Doctors used to mercurate certain ailments in the past.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mercurated my salad with the wrong dressing.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to mercurate the atmosphere with tension.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to mercurate the canvas with shimmering colors.

meanings.sent5: The potion seemed to mercurate strength into the weak warrior.
